text: this is Sorrell it's a hardy green with
a bright tart flavor that works really
well with seafood particularly scallops
so I'm gonna use sorrel in a buttery
sauce for sea scallops I'm going to
season first with a little bit salt and
a little bit of pepper and whenever you
sear something you want to get your pan
really hot first before you add your
butter so you see that these scallops
are on a piece of paper towel and that's
to make sure they are super dry because
if I want to get a nice golden sear on
them and there's any moisture on the
bottoms they're gonna steam and they
won't get brown I know I'm just waiting
for this foam to subside because that's
when I know that the butter is hot
enough and if the butter turns a little
bit Brown that is perfectly fine that
adds great flavor so don't worry about
it but and my scallops because scallops
are so easy to overcook I am just gonna
let these cook on one side until they
get really brown on that one side and
then I'm not gonna sear them on the
other side after I make my sauce I'm
gonna put them back in take it side down
and that's gonna finish cooking them
without overcooking yeah look how
beautiful that is that is what I want
just on one side right now I'm gonna put
my garlic in the pan see all of this
brown stuff on the bottom of the pan
this is the foundation of the sauce it
tastes so good I don't want to lose any
of it as soon as my garlic it's just
fragrant I'm gonna add a little bit of
removing and raising it this is getting
all that good stuff into the sauce now I
add my butter and my sorrel
I just wanted to show you this whole
leaf so you would know what it looked
like this sorrel is just gonna melt it
just turns so silky now normally when
I'm doing scallops or any kind of
seafood I like to add lemon but sorrel
is so lemony it has such a tart flavor
that you don't need it here it's
providing all that contrast to the
sweetness of the shellfish the sorrel
which was bright green is now turned
kind of drab and brownish in the pan and
okay that's what happens when you put
heat to sorrow I am gonna perk it up
with some chives at the end so it'll
look good and then I'm just gonna add
the scallops back in and then they're
gonna finish cooking and then that's it
they're done I'm just gonna put them on
the plate and spoon the sauce around it
and chives just a little bit they add
color but they also add just a little
bit of a bite and then that's that these
are ready to go if you can't find sorrel
you really can't use any leafy herb to
make this dish but with sorrel
it tastes like sperm
all
